juliefordherbison: I get it that sometimes something really awful happens and we cry at work. Please do not encourage white tears that just perpetuate racial biases. White women tears (she’s being authentic, vulnerable, needs some self care or a mental health break) POC tears ( not professional, doesn’t have their shit together, isn’t a good fit for the company, isn’t grateful for the job, is so easily offended and makes everything about race.) if you want to make the company you own a safe crying space great but that is a luxury afforded to you that most do not have. kathanista: When my father died a few years ago due to complications of early onset Alzheimer’s, I was so numb and busy with family and arrangements that I didn’t cry at all. Thank GOD I found a tribe of women bonded by our shared experiences of crying in advisors’ offices or after being grilled in a defense or due to a mansplaining twerp in a seminar or just because school is stressful and hard and disheartening. Thank you for normalizing and celebrating the feeling and emoting of the not-so-happy side of our lives.
quesarara: I highly recommend breathwork. It moves all the emotional energy around and out of you. You're free to laugh, cry, scream and release all ya want! @rebeccakordecki is a great guide if you're looking for a place in LA.
sabiaapothecary: i’ve been told not to cry at work so many times i wanna puke and to that i say- “you know what, ya jerk? i run my own business, suffer when the biz doesn’t do well, work for free constantly when you get paid, handle every crisis in the middle of the night or when i’m on ‘vacation’ and maintain a semi healthy home life and have a baby, too. so if i wanna cry at work you can just Fuck. Right. Off. next” and then i smile because i love all creatures and want to spread love and light ✨✨✨✨
gatospantalones: I don’t cry at work but the other night at home something set me off and I sobbed. I hadn’t cried in so long it actually felt good. I hold everything in. Thank you for your posts. You’re the best 🌈
iamsteph_xx: Thank you for using your voice and your heart.🙏.... for making you so vulnerable in the name of us all... it's a tough life task being a gamechanger in this world... But you do look really good.. Though🖤
megpjones: This is great. I cried at a job interview once. Awkward but necessary. 💕
karma.on.insta: I remember a record album from the 70’s called Free to be you and me. There’s a song called It’s alright to cry, crying get sad out of you 🎶! That record was so great. And taught me a lot of really good lessons.
love_kristinmarie: I love you for doing this💕

popejoandesignstudio: It’s true. You really are THE best. 🖤👏

visualheart: I cry at work, except I work alone at home so it's got a different vibe to it. Thanks for speaking about this. 💗
sadiejetaime: Omg. I love this. Can I work for you?
jbbin: I think social media can be a really great thing but unfortunately not enough people have your philosophy of sharing. I know people who are really unhappy in real life but from Instagram you’d think their life was perfect. We could all cry a little more and show it a little more. Thanks
spoonfulsugarco: Yep I’ve had a good cry at a few companies, it’s a release... I’m also very lucky I work for myself now! 🙌🌈😊
bethhayesking: Thank you! I am grateful for this. I realize I feel the most shame about crying at work when it is about work- being overwhelmed, frustrated, mad, exhausted, stressed. lolo_rad_o: This is the first job that I have yet to cry at, but I know it’s coming! We’re in this together 🧡
secretworldofsarahmac: Thank you so much for this. As a psychologist who works at a community clinic, I get the implicit message that I’m supposed to be emotionless and can handle anything. I have always tried to have a “don’t cry at work” policy, and then beat myself up when I do cry. I’m going to try to be kinder to myself.
von_hop_along: I think that being open will resonate with a lot of people. Its important for other people to see its not a thing "only crazy people do". That emotions are natural, because as much as it seems like common sense, its NOT. Cheers to ending the stigma! 🎉⚡❤️
beckylongstocking: my girlfriend recently quit a job where the CEO made a mandate that anyone who cried at work, publicly or in private, would be fired immediately. I immediately bought the “I Cry At Work” shirt, and I plan on wearing it when I go with her to pick up her last check. 💕
